titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Nehemiah Denton land records 1974.228
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T11:04-0500

did.abstract: The Nehemiah Denton Wilkins land records span the period 1879 to 1907 and consist of leases, sales contracts and deeds for properties located on Smith St., Henry St. and Myrtle Ave. in Brooklyn.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1974.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Nehemiah Denton Wilkins land records, 1974.228, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Brooklyn Historical Society also owns the Nehemiah Denton papers (1977.171). Nehemiah Denton Wilkins was the grandson and heir of Nehemiah Denton. Please contact the Othmer Library staff for more information on this collection.
